column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: If I am unable to prevent a migraine by immediately taking 600 mg ibuprofin, this is the only migraine drug that works for me. I wish my insurance would recognize how unique and effective this drug is -- nothing else works, once I have a full-grade migraine. I do feel a bit dizzy after taking it, and my skin is very sensitive to heat (e.g., when washing my hands), but the minor side effects are nothing compared to a migraine! The only concern I have is the fact that it is so powerful, I worry about the long-term effects.

column2: bcre8tiv, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This has by far been the most effective triptan for me.  I take it with 500mg.Naproxan, and that's it, once and it is gone within two hrs. I follow up with another dose of the Naproxan. Very $$$$

column2: lheuberger, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: it works pretty good for me.  i too have been experiencing dizziness and was not sure if it was the meds.  i also can feel very emotional at times with Relpax.  i took Maxalt before but the side effects got too bad after several years.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication realy worked for me.I did not like how dizzy and lite headed it made me. not only for that day but the next day also.Almost made it impossible to get up and do my daily activities.i had to have someone come over and help me with my chores.

column2: ewilli37, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Apparently I am the only one, but this medicine gives me terrible lockjaw. I cannot take it if I am at work because I have to talk all day and cannot after taking the drug. Other then that it works better than any other i have tried.

column2: bsb9754, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have used Relpax for over a year.  This medicine worked very well for me.  I don't seem to have as severe of headaches when I do have them.  The only drawback is the cost.  They are so expensive.

column2: LMAC, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: If taken on first onset, very effective results quickly.  No side effects.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: If taken when you first feel the migraine come on this drug is wonderful. Just rest for 15-30 minutes (at least for me) and eventually the beginnings of the headache will dissolve away.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: This is is the best medicine for severe headaches.  My only complaint is that it is hard to get out of the package and when you have a bad headache the last thing you want to do is struggle with getting to the medicine.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I can take Relpax and still function.Nothing else has ever worked. it was still brand new when I started on it. Only once has it not worked for me. I wish my insurance would cover it.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: If taken @the 1st onset, very effective. After being on it for 1 year, I noticed an immediate  throbbing headache at the base of my skull during an orgasm. It has happened the last 2 times. Applying an ice pack immediately seems to help but the following day, my head still hurt.
